1410974 THE NATIONAL TAX TRIBUNAL (AMENDMENT) Act, 2007
No. 18 of 2007 [ 3rd April, 2007.]
An Act to amend the National Tax Tribunal Act, 2005.
Be it enacted by Parliament in the Fifty- eighth Year of the Republic of India as
follows:-
761556 1 Short title and commencement.-
105277 1This Act may be called the National Tax Tribunal (Amendment) Act, 2007.
1097283 2It shall be deemed to have come into force on the 29th day of January, 2007.
1147173 2 Amendment of section 5.- In section 5 of the National Tax Tribunal Act, 2005 (hereinafter referred to as the principal Act), in sub- section (5),-
154015 ithe words" in consultation with the Chairperson" shall be omitted;
973267 iithe following proviso shall be inserted, namely:- " Provided that no Member shall be transferred without the concurrence of the Chairperson.".
192223 3Amendment of section 6.- In section 6 of the principal Act, in sub- section (2), in clause (b), for the words" seven years", the words" five years" shall be substituted.
1945927 4Amendment of section 13.- In section 13 of the principal Act, in sub- section 1, the words" or any person duly authorised by him or it" shall be omitted.
1068203 5 Repeal and saving.-
1552671 1The National Tax Tribunal (Amendment) Ordinance, 2007 is hereby repealed.
362283 2Notwithstanding the repeal of the National Tax Tribunal (Amendment) Ordinance, 2007, anything done or any action taken under the principal Act, as amended by the said Ordinance, shall be deemed to have been done or taken under the corresponding provisions of the principal Act, as amended by this Act. ----
K. N. Chaturvedi,
Secy. to the Govt. of India.
